sub_title: Senior Research Analyst at TDi Sustainability
summary: I have a broad range of experience in the humanitarian and development sector, working with a variety of organisations from the grassroots level through to large government donors in diverse contexts around the world. After involvement in small-scale livelihoods and upcycling projects, in addition to grant management experience with the British government in Myanmar, I am now utilising my skills in GIS,  research as well as information & project management. I am currently working in the responsible mining sector in East Africa, primarily in gold value chains. In addition to an analytical mindset and a highly organised working style, I have a passion for organisation building - aiming to use my previous experiences to improve how my current team operates.

education.degree_name: Master's in Environment and Resource Management

awards.title: TARGETjobs First Year Undergraduate of the Year
awards.description: Awarded the First Year Undergraduate of the Year out of 355 applicants, winning a six-week summer internship programme with Ernst & Young and a place at an international leadership conference in Florida.

profile_positions.description: As part of efforts to have supply chains source their minerals more responsibly, I carry out research for TDI Sustainability. Specifically, I am analysing certain segments of the cobalt and gold value chains in order to identify actors who influence where and how extraction, processing and trade takes place. In addition, I have worked on the measurement of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) performance in certain industry and its influence on investment.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Analyst

profile_positions.description: I primarily work within the Lake Victoria Gold Programme, which aims to improve the productivity, legality and working conditions in artisanal & small-scale gold mines in Kenya and Uganda by facilitating access to investment. In addition to supporting the collaboration of the project's consortium partners, my role is to map out the location and performance of all of the mining sites that we are cooperating with, as well as helping to develop improvement plans that will allow them access to investment finance.
profile_positions.title: Project Implementation Officer

profile_positions.description: I provided research and administrative assistance, including gathering information on cobalt mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo; compiling a research report on artisanal & small-scale gold mining in Kenya; transcribing conference dialogue and improving the organisation's website.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: 510 An Initiative of the Netherlands Red Cross

profile_positions.company: 510 - An Initiative of the Netherlands Red Cross
profile_positions.description: Red Cross 510 improves the speed, quality and cost-effectiveness of humanitarian aid by using data & digital products. By creating open data sets and providing humanitarian data analysis, Red Cross 510 supports disaster preparedness, early warning and disaster response. As a part-time volunteer I have streamlined information management for the Aruba Red Cross COVID-19 supermarket voucher scheme; drafted a methodology for assessing local flood impact in Malawi with automated transcription of newspaper articles; managed data for the Dutch COVID-19 helpline and co-ordinate improving an app designed for undocumented migrants in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Data & Digital Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
At the beginning of 2019 I spent two months in Jordan, including volunteering at the Al Numeira Environmental Association (NEA) which aims to improve environmental awareness of both Jordanians and international tourists through modelling water conservation methods, using sustainable building materials, offering locally grown and prepared food and sustainable tourism in the form of biking and hiking tours of the South Ghor area. 

Whilst on site I:
-upcycled old bicycles to add to NEA's inventory for hosting tours as well as establishing a bicycle maintenance schedule
-improved the accounting and administration involved in managing all of NEA's activities
-visited a farm that supplies produce for the organisation to try and establish a seasonal harvest calendar
-welcomed guests to NEA where they can try some local dishes and be shown around the site to see how NEA's various projects operate
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

company.name: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme Facility (DfID)

profile_positions.company: Humanitarian Assistance and Resilience Programme Facility (DfID)
profile_positions.description:
At the country office for the HARP Facility, a UK Department for International Development-funded donor, I supported both operational and programmatic activities, primarily: 
-Supporting the collection, analysis and presentation of programme information and partner activity, including a review of partner practices in the Prevention of Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA), designing flyers promoting the HARP Facility's funding instruments and mapping the distribution of funding by sector across Myanmar 
-Supporting recruiting and hiring efforts, specifically drafting vacancy postings and finding, contacting and negotiating with translators
-Minute-taking on meetings with partner and associate organisations, such as a safety and security discussion amongst various INGOs and UNDSS or an information session held by UNOCHA explaining how funding decisions are made for the Myanmar Humanitarian Fund
-Providing administrative support during grant-making processes, for example managing the organisation's website and Facebook page, communicating grant updates with potential and confirmed partners and establishing a more functional conference calling system
-Assisting staff members with IT requests wherever possible as well as formatting and editing documents and templates, including proofreading the nationwide report on vulnerability undertaken by the HARP Facility and the Myanmar Information Management Unit (MIMU), a UN body
profile_positions.title: Operations and Programme Support Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
I provided ad hoc support at HELVETAS Myanmar for internal and external communication documents, including:
-Ensuring that all internal communication documents comply with global corporate design guidelines
-Review and improve publications advertising HELVETAS Myanmar's work on livelihoods and natural resource development
-Proofreading
profile_positions.title: Documentation Support Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
-Formulated a financial forecast of a project to introduce ducks to rice farms to provide secondary sources of income to farmers and act as natural 
-Provided guidance on loan repayment schedules, purchasing and salaries
-Partook in a Participatory Capacity and Vulnerability Assessment (PCVA) in an isolated community that primarily relies on subsistence farming
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
-Following a working holiday in Australia I travelled from the north to south of Europe, coast to coast in South America, hitchhiked to northern Africa and volunteered as a financial analyst in the Philippines.
-Funded the majority of my break working as a freelance rickshaw driver & city tour guide in cities across the world.
-As part of my life ambition to run seven marathons on seven continents I used this sabbatical period to run marathons in Australia, Morocco, Northern Ireland and Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Extended Break for Travel

profile_positions.description:
-Completed an internship as a systems analyst/project manager intern in Financial Services & Solutions and Product & Asset Accounting Solutions at Procter & Gamble.
-Managed the implementation of SAP system upgrades to reduce productivity losses in addition to streamlining the intern onboarding process and initiating a platform to increase global staff connectivity.
profile_positions.title: IDS (Information & Decision Solutions) Systems Analyst Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: The 2020 edition of the AidEx focussed on various NGO and governmental responses to the Coronavirus, mainly in support of social programmes to deal with the psychological, economic and social outcomes of the COVID-19 pandemic. Other sessions I attended discussed the humanitarian-peace-development nexus and its place in humanitarian and developmental interventions, as well as the increasing role of the private sector in developing and producing products for livelihood programmes and humanitarian response.

-I attended the 2018 Aid Expo in Brussels in November which allowed me the opportunity to speak with many suppliers of relief and development products such as water filters, temporary shelters, food rations, or solar-powered devices, as well as hearing experienced humanitarian workers discuss current trends and what they think should be focused on in the future

-The nineteenth edition of the Congress focussed on reshaping humanitarianism, particularly the changes that are required to ensure a functioning and reactive humanitarian system capable of responding to an increasingly complex geopolitical landscape.

-Helping with the protection of rare plant species by applying sustainable agricultural practices such as permaculture. The main objective of the project is to ensure food security and protect biodiversity.

volunteer_experiences.role: John o'Groats to Land's End Cyclist
volunteer_experiences.description: As part of a team of 8 people, I cycled from the most northeasterly point of mainland Britain, John o'Groats, to its most southwesterly point, Land's End. I covered 1,075 miles over 16 days in order to raise £2,000 for The Daisy Chain Project - a charity that helps children with autism.
